page.title: 09 The Red Cross,Oxford
page.content: The Red Cross is a voluntary organisation to help people in distress, especially in wars. Every town in Great Britain has a Red Cross organisation with the biggest one in London. In Oxford, the meetings are held at 101 Banbury Road. The Red Cross help in accidents or fires. They drive ambulances and run clubs for handicapped and old people. They also run old peoples' homes. Once a year, they take big parties of handicapped people on holiday to places like Butlins, because they have chalets and no stairs. The people love the holidays even if it is raining. There are also outings. Members of the Red Cross who do First Aid have to take exams in nursing. In times of war the Red Cross helps all countries because it is neutral.It also looks for missing persons.
